attributes.action: Home office to overturn the conviction of Acting Sergeant Blades
attributes.additional_details: Acting Sergeant Blades was convicted of dangerous driving all because he was doing his job to catch criminals. In doing so he has blocked the path of offenders trying to make off with his patrol car. It is my opinion that Acting Sergeant Blades was merely trying to protect the public from these offenders and should therefore have his conviction overturned
attributes.background: Sergeant Blades has a criminal background and has had to pay £100 to each of his apparent victims. All because he was trying to do his job

rejection.details:
Courts are independent of the Government and Parliament.You can find out more about appealing against a sentence here:

https://www.gov.uk/appeal-against-sentence-conviction/magistrates-court-verdict

If you would like Parliament to change the law that applies in similar cases, you could start a petition calling for the specific change you want.
